Event.0: BC Date Maya/Mesoamerican Long Count Calendar starts dating from (as corresponds to the Julian Calendar).
Event.1: Italian operatic lyric tenor Luciano Pavarotti, who was considered one of the finest bel canto opera singers of the 20th century, died.
Event.2: Tuvalu, a group of nine coral islands in the west-central Pacific with a population of about 10,000, became the 189th member of the United Nations.
Event.3: The Soviet Union recognized the independence of the Baltic states—Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania.
Event.4:
Geert Wilders
Dutch politician
was born
Event.5:
Chris Christie
American politician
was born
Event.6:
Carly Fiorina
American business executive and politician
was born
Event.7: "La Strada" directed by Federico Fellini premieres at the Venice Film Festival starring Anthony Quinn
Event.8: Germany fired the first long-range V-2 missile at an Allied target during World War II.
Event.9: Actor Yul Brynner (24) weds actress Virginia Gilmore (25) at the Los Angeles County Courthouse
Event.10: 1st true supermarket, the "Piggly Wiggly" is opened by Clarence Saunders in Memphis, Tennessee
Event.11: World War I: First Battle of the Marne begins, French and British forces prevent German advance on Paris (till the 12th Sept)
Event.12: French and British forces launched an offensive against advancing Germans in the First Battle of the Marne during World War I.
Event.13: Word received that American explorer Robert Peary had discovered the North Pole, 5 months earlier
Event.14:
U.S. President William McKinley assassinated
Republican William McKinley, the 25th president of the United States (1897–1901), was shot this day in 1901 by Leon Czolgosz, an anarchist, at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, New York, and died eight days later.
Event.15: US President William McKinley is shot by Leon Czolgosz, an anarchist, while visiting the Pan-American Exposition in New York
Event.16: Explorer Fridtjof Nansen (27) weds mezzosoprano singer Eva Nansen (30)
Event.17:
Joseph P. Kennedy
American businessman
was born
Event.18: W. G. Grace scores 152 in debut Test Cricket innings, v Aust The Oval
Event.19: American social reformer and pacifist Jane Addams, cowinner (with Nicholas Murray Butler) of the Nobel Prize for Peace in 1931, was born.
Event.20:
Jane Addams
American social reformer
was born
Event.21: Publisher James Gordon Bennett (45) weds Henrietta Agnes Crean in NYC, New York
Event.22: French Revolutionary leader Georges Danton was elected deputy for Paris to the National Convention.
Event.23: Mozart's opera "La Clemenza di Tito" premieres in Prague
Event.24: The Mayflower departs Plymouth, England with 102 Pilgrims and about 30 crew for the New World
Event.25: Ferdinand Magellan's Spanish expedition aboard the Vitoria returns to Spain without their captain. First to circumnavigate the earth.
